header_summary:
The recent launch of Bitcoin Core version 26.1 offers multiple enhancements including wallet functionality, RPC fixes, and P2P improvements, ensuring a better user experience. Available for download from the [Bitcoin Core website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-26.1/) or via BitTorrent, this update is compatible with previous versions, though it advises a proper shutdown of older versions before installation. The software’s compatibility spans across various operating systems including Linux kernel-based systems, macOS 11.0 and newer, and Windows 7 and above, highlighting its extensive testing and reliability in diverse environments.

Constellation introduces an innovative L3 protocol aimed at resolving UX challenges in the blockchain's initial layers by ensuring a 1:1 backing with L2 channels. Through its federated security model and a ROAST-wrapped FROST protocol, it enables efficient consensus, high throughput, and near-instant confirmation times within its unique UTXO-based ledger system. This approach not only facilitates seamless cross-operator transactions and liquidity management but also offers a developer-friendly platform for building L3 wallets, enhancing offline transaction capabilities and light client protocol support.

Discussions on 0-conf offchain operations highlight the significance of conditions for accepting transactions without confirmation, focusing on swaps with the same party to establish immediate trust. The comparison between swap-in-potentiam (SIP) and payjoin-in-potentiam (PIP) protocols emphasizes SIP’s user convenience for mobile wallets and PIP's advantages in privacy, transaction efficiency, and fee savings. This conversation underscores the importance of balancing innovation with reliability and security in transaction protocols.

Fee rate estimate analyses indicate discrepancies mainly during network congestion, with a detailed review of block `832478` confirming the 50th percentile estimate accuracy at `150 sat/vB`. The discussions suggest that higher fees do not necessarily ensure faster block inclusion, prompting a reconsideration of estimation mechanisms. Proposed adjustments aim to enhance fee rate estimate visualizations using both linear and logarithmic scales, improving the understanding of fee rate distributions and addressing the issue of transaction exclusion due to lower fee rates.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 26.1 released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 26.1 is now available for download, featuring bug fixes and performance enhancements.
- The update supports older wallet versions and is compatible with Linux, macOS 11.0+, and Windows 7+.
- Significant improvements include wallet functionality, RPC fixes, and enhanced P2P/network operations.

recent_posts.title: Constellation - a high performance Lightning-based L3. Feedback wanted
recent_posts.summary:
- Constellation, an L3 protocol, aims to solve UX issues in blockchain with a 1:1 fund backing.
- It introduces a federated security model and a unique ledger system for efficient consensus.
- Offers developers tools for building wallets and balances financial interconnectivity with sovereignty.

recent_posts.title: Payjoin-in-Potentiam: Externally fund an LSP channel open with one transaction
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion focuses on handling 0-conf offchain operations, emphasizing transaction acceptance based on originating swaps.
- It contrasts SIP and PIP protocols, highlighting SIP's user convenience and PIP's cost-saving and privacy enhancements.
- The narrative advocates for cautious protocol development, balancing innovation with transaction integrity and security.

recent_posts.title: Mempool Based Fee Estimation on Bitcoin Core
recent_posts.summary:
- Discrepancies in fee rate estimates mainly occur with estimation-actual time gaps over 10 minutes.
- Analysis of block `832478` confirms the 50th percentile estimate's accuracy at `150 sat/vB`.
- Adjustments made to graph plotting include linear and logarithmic scales for better data visualization.

active_posts.title: Adding New BIP Editors
active_posts.summary:
- Luke's inability to manage BIPs has led to a push for more editors.
- New editors must agree on the BIP numbering scheme and have a strong track record.
- Kanzure and RubenSomsen are proposed to enhance BIP management and development.

active_posts.title: The Future of Bitcoin Testnet
active_posts.summary:
- Testnet3 faces challenges with coin distribution and operational inconsistencies due to a bug.
- Misuse of Testnet3 for scammy airdrops has led to an unintended TBTC marketplace.
- Solutions like testnet reset, addressing the bug, or moving to signet are being considered.

active_posts.title: A Free-Relay Attack Exploiting Min-Relay-Fee Differences
active_posts.summary:
- Peter Todd details a free-relay attack exploiting low minrelayfees on large mempool miners.
- The attack involves publishing transactions with manipulated fee-rates to double-spend and recuperate funds.
- Discussing this strategy aims for public awareness and collective mitigation effort exploration.

active_posts.title: BTC Lisp as an alternative to Script
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal integrates Lisp into Bitcoin's blockchain to improve transaction scripts without changing the UTXO database.
- `btclisp.py`, a Python Lisp interpreter, facilitates Lisp's integration for complex transaction logic exploration.
- Despite challenges, integrating Lisp offers promising advancements in blockchain technology and scripting flexibility.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- AntoineP discusses improving Bitcoin's security and efficiency, including fixing the timewarp vulnerability.
- The proposal suggests limiting legacy transaction sizes and invalidating small transactions to protect the network.
- Community debates emerge over block size reduction and standardizing technical elements, focusing on scalability and security.

active_posts.title: DSL for experimenting with contracts
active_posts.summary:
- The DSL for bitcoin contracts simplifies transaction processes and system state assertions.
- It enables direct bitcoin node interaction and automates signature generation through descriptive syntax.
- Documentation and examples are available, promising utility enhancement through ongoing development.

today_in_history_posts.summary:

today_in_history_posts.title: [BOLT Draft] Onion Routing Spec
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Christian Decker proposed a Sphinx-like spec draft with new key and stream algorithms.
- The implementation introduces fixed-size payloads for instructions and unused end-to-end messages.
- It's been implemented in Go and C, with a tool for cross-version packet handling.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:

- The article explores stabilizing economies through a currency system backed by deflationary assets like Bitcoin.
